Key Match Events: Canada's Richie Laryea and Uruguay's Nahitan Nandez battled for the ball during the Copa America third place soccer match.
David scores the first penalty for Canada.
Bombito slots in the second penalty for Canada.
Choinière drives in the third penalty for Canada.
Davies hits the bar on the final penalty for Canada.
Valverde, Bentancur, Arrascaeta, and Suárez scored penalties for Uruguay.
Suárez makes it 2-2 in added time, likely in his final international match.
Jonathan David scored for Canada, making it 28 international goals for him.
Marsch made a double substitution, bringing in Liam Millar and Theo Bair.
Post-Match Reflections: It's a tough end for Marsch's side, but what a run from Les Rouges.
All eyes are on Canada heading into the 2026 World Cup on home soil.
Uruguay may have finished third, but Canada captured the hearts of people around the world with brave performances.
This is only the beginning of the journey for Canada.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Canada finished top 4 at the 2024 Copa America.
Uruguay is ranked 14th in the world according to FIFA, while Canada is ranked 48th.
